general_city_data.description: Madrid, the vibrant capital of Spain, is a city that seamlessly blends historical grandeur with modern energy. Known for its elegant boulevards, expansive parks like El Retiro, and world-renowned art museums such as the Prado, Reina Sofía, and Thyssen-Bornemisza, Madrid offers a rich cultural experience. The city boasts a lively nightlife, delicious tapas scene, and a palpable passion for life. From the Royal Palace to the bustling Plaza Mayor, Madrid captivates visitors with its architectural beauty and warm, welcoming atmosphere. It's a city where tradition and innovation coexist, creating an unforgettable experience for every traveler.
general_city_data.timezone: Central European Time (CET) / Central European Summer Time (CEST)
general_city_data.weather: Madrid has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and cool, wet winters. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures.
general_city_data.attractions: Prado Museum, Reina Sofía Museum, Royal Palace of Madrid, El Retiro Park, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, Gran Vía, Temple of Debod, Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, Almudena Cathedral
general_city_data.history: Madrid's history dates back to the 9th century when it was a Moorish fortress. It became the capital of Spain in 1561 under King Philip II. The city has played a significant role in Spanish history, witnessing numerous political and social changes. It has evolved from a royal seat to a modern metropolis, retaining its historical charm while embracing contemporary culture.

itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary offers a flexible approach to exploring Madrid, catering to a traveler with no specific preferences beyond a 5km radius. It prioritizes iconic landmarks and cultural experiences, allowing for spontaneous deviations based on your mood and discoveries. The suggested activities range from historical sites to vibrant markets, offering a diverse taste of Madrid's charm. Remember to wear comfortable shoes, as you'll be doing a lot of walking! Adapt the pace to your liking, linger longer at places that capture your interest, and embrace the unexpected delights that Madrid has to offer. Public transport is readily available, but walking allows you to truly soak in the atmosphere of this captivating city.

points_of_interest.name: Museo Nacional del Prado
points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the world's greatest art museums, housing masterpieces by Spanish masters like Goya, Velázquez, and El Greco, as well as international artists. Allow at least 3 hours to explore.

points_of_interest.name: Parque del Retiro
points_of_interest.description_poi: A sprawling green oasis in the heart of Madrid. Rent a rowboat on the lake, visit the Crystal Palace, or simply relax and enjoy the atmosphere. Perfect for a leisurely stroll or picnic.

points_of_interest.name: Plaza Mayor
points_of_interest.description_poi: A grand and historic square surrounded by beautiful architecture. A great place to people-watch, grab a coffee, or browse the shops. Often hosts events and markets.

points_of_interest.name: Mercado de San Miguel
points_of_interest.description_poi: A vibrant and modern food market offering a wide variety of tapas, drinks, and local delicacies. A great place to sample Spanish cuisine and soak in the atmosphere.
points_of_interest.address: Plaza de San Miguel, s/n, 28005 Madrid

points_of_interest.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
points_of_interest.description_poi: The official residence of the Spanish Royal Family, although it is only used for state ceremonies. Explore the opulent rooms, admire the art collection, and enjoy the views from the palace gardens.
